com.github.crashdemons.playerheads

Class SkullConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.crashdemons.playerheads.SkullConverter

  • public final class SkullConverter
extends Object
    Abstract class defining methods for converting between entities, custom skullState type, and legacy username-skulls, etc.
    Author:
    crashdemons

    • Method Detail

      • skullTypeFromEntity

        public static TexturedSkullType skullTypeFromEntity(org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
        Convert an entity type to a TexturedSkullType. Most mobs (and the player) have a 1:1 mapping. Note: At the time of writing in 1.13.1 all entities with isAlive() have associated TexturedSkullType's with the exception of GIANT and ARMOR_STAND. Not all entities will have an associated skulltype, not all living entities will have an associated skulltype.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to get a skull for
        Returns:
        The associated TexturedSkullType, if one exists. Otherwise, null.

      • getSkullOwningPlayer

        public static org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer getSkullOwningPlayer(org.bukkit.inventory.meta.SkullMeta skullMeta)
        Gets the owner player from a playerhead. If there is no OwningPlayer result, this infers one from head's "profile" field.
        Parameters:
        skullMeta - ItemMeta for a playerhead item
        Returns:
        the owning player of the skull

      • getSkullOwningPlayer

        public static org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer getSkullOwningPlayer(org.bukkit.block.Skull skullBlockState)
        Gets the owner username from a playerhead. If there is no OwningPlayer result, this infers one from head's "profile" field.
        Parameters:
        skullBlockState - BlockState for a playerhead block
        Returns:
        the username of the head's owner

      • getSkullOwner

        Gets the owner username from a playerhead.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the username of the head's owner

        Gets the owner username from a playerhead.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the username of the head's owner

      • skullTypeFromItemStack

        public static TexturedSkullType skullTypeFromItemStack(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack stack)
        Attempts to determine a TexturedSkullType from an itemstack's information. This first attempts to guess the skulltype from the stacks's Material (whether it is a player or vanilla head drop). If it is a player-head, then it checks whether the associated UUID matches a TexturedSkullType entry.
        Parameters:
        stack - The stack to determine the skulltype of.
        Returns:
        • A TexturedSkullType associated with the mob (if material or UUID matched),
        • null (if the material is unsupported)
        • TexturedSkullType.PLAYER (if a playerhead UUID was not associated with any mob)

      • skullTypeFromItemStackLegacy

        @Deprecated
public static TexturedSkullType skullTypeFromItemStackLegacy(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack stack)
        Deprecated. Legacy username-based mobheads are supported for backwards-compatibility reasons but are deprecated in the long term, skullTypeFromBlockState should be used if legacy support is not needed.
        Attempts to determine a TexturedSkullType from a itemstack's information, with support for legacy username-based mobheads. This method first checks skullTypeFromItemStack() for skulltype. If the skulltype returned is TexturedSkullType.PLAYER (unknown playerhead), then this method attempts to associate the head's username with a LegacySkullType and upgrade it to the respective TexturedSkullType.
        Parameters:
        stack - The stack to determine the skulltype of.
        Returns:
        • A TexturedSkullType associated with the mob (if material or UUID matched),
        • null (if the material is unsupported)
        • TexturedSkullType.PLAYER (if a playerhead UUID and username was not associated with any mob)
        See Also:
        skullTypeFromItemStack(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack), LegacySkullType

      • skullTypeFromBlockState

        public static TexturedSkullType skullTypeFromBlockState(org.bukkit.block.BlockState state)
        Attempts to determine a TexturedSkullType from a block's blockstate information. This first attempts to guess the skulltype from the block's Material (whether it is a player or vanilla head drop). If it is a player-head, then it checks whether the associated UUID matches a TexturedSkullType entry.
        Parameters:
        state - The state associated with a block to determine the skulltype of.
        Returns:
        • A TexturedSkullType associated with the mob (if material or UUID matched),
        • null (if the material is unsupported)
        • TexturedSkullType.PLAYER (if a playerhead UUID was not associated with any mob)

      • skullTypeFromBlockStateLegacy

        @Deprecated
public static TexturedSkullType skullTypeFromBlockStateLegacy(org.bukkit.block.BlockState state)
        Deprecated. Legacy username-based mobheads are supported for backwards-compatibility reasons but are deprecated in the long term, skullTypeFromBlockState should be used if legacy support is not needed.
        Attempts to determine a TexturedSkullType from a block's blockstate information, with support for legacy username-based mobheads. This method first checks skullTypeFromBlockState() for skulltype. If the skulltype returned is TexturedSkullType.PLAYER (unknown playerhead), then this method attempts to associate the head's username with a LegacySkullType and upgrade it to the respective TexturedSkullType.
        Parameters:
        state - The state associated with a block to determine the skulltype of.
        Returns:
        • A TexturedSkullType associated with the mob (if material or UUID matched),
        • null (if the material is unsupported)
        • TexturedSkullType.PLAYER (if a playerhead UUID and username was not associated with any mob)
        See Also:
        skullTypeFromBlockState(org.bukkit.block.BlockState), LegacySkullType

      • upgradeSkullTypeLegacy

        @Deprecated
public static TexturedSkullType upgradeSkullTypeLegacy(LegacySkullType oldType)
        Deprecated. Legacy username-based mobheads are supported for backwards-compatibility reasons but are deprecated in the long term.
        Attempts to convert a LegacySkullType (username-based mobhead) to TexturedSkullType (texture-based mobhead). Simple enum name conversion is used in this method. Note: since 3.x changes making CustomSkullType (now LegacySkullType) uniform with bukkit's EntityType naming scheme, all enum names in LegacySkullType should be present in TexturedSkullType.
        Parameters:
        oldType - The LegacySkullType to convert
        Returns:
        The associated TexturedSkullType for the mobhead, or TexturedSkullType.PLAYER if no conversion was supported.
        See Also:
        LegacySkullType, TexturedSkullType

      • entityTypeFromSkullType

        public static org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityTypeFromSkullType(TexturedSkullType skullType)
        Attempts to get a bukkit EntityType from the given TexturedSkullType. Simple enum name conversion is used in this method - TexturedSkullType is intended to have all entries be in the same format as EntityType. Any entry in TexturedSkullType that doesn't exist in EntityType should be considered a bug or breaking changes in the bukkit API between major versions.
        Parameters:
        skullType - The TexturedSkullType to find the associated entity-type for.
        Returns:
        The EntityType associated with the skulltype if one is found. Otherwise, in case of breaking API changes, returns null.
